title: How to Log Out of Messenger Remotely: 2 Easy Ways

steps.title: Open the Messenger app on your Android, iPhone, or iPad.
steps.content: Open the Messenger app on your Android, iPhone, or iPad. If you're signed in to Facebook Messenger or Facebook on another device, you can log out remotely using the Messenger app on your phone or tablet. Make sure you are signed in to Messenger using the account you want to log out remotely. This process will also log you out of Facebook on the devices you select.

steps.title: Tap the menu ☰.
steps.content: Tap the menu ☰ . You'll see this three-lined menu icon in the lower right corner on an Android, or the upper-left corner on an iPhone or iPad. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's next to an icon of a gear. This will expand another menu down. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Meta Accounts Center.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Meta Accounts Center . It's the large box at the bottom of the menu. This opens an area where you can adjust your Meta account settings, as well as log out from remote devices.

steps.title: Tap Password and security.
steps.content: Tap Password and security . It's next to an icon that looks like a shield. It should be the third option below "Account settings."

steps.title: Tap Where you're logged in.
steps.content: Tap Where you're logged in . This displays a list of Meta accounts you are signed into (i.e., Facebook, Instagram, Threads).

steps.title: Select your Facebook account.
steps.content: Select your Facebook account. If you have more than one Meta account, tap the Facebook account you want to log out from. This will display a list of all devices you are logged into using that account. You can also remotely log out of your Instagram or Threads accounts remotely from here.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Select devices to log out.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Select devices to log out . It's the red text at the bottom of the page.

steps.title: Select the device(s) you want to log out of.
steps.content: Select the device(s) you want to log out of. Tap the checkboxes next to each device you want to log out from. If you want to log out from Messenger everywhere, tap Select all at the top to select all devices at once.

steps.title: Tap Log Out.
steps.content: Tap Log Out . It's the large blue button at the bottom of the page. This logs you out of Facebook and Facebook Messenger on all the devices you selected.

steps.title: Go to https://www.facebook.com in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.facebook.com in a web browser. You can use any web browser on your computer. If you left yourself logged in to Messenger on another device (like on a school or work computer or a friend's phone), you can sign out of that session with this method. If you aren't signed into Facebook automatically, use the username and password associated with your Facebook account to log in.

steps.title: Click your profile picture at the top-right corner.
steps.content: Click your profile picture at the top-right corner. This expands a menu with several options.

steps.title: Click Settings & privacy.
steps.content: Click Settings & privacy . It's the second option below your various profiles. Another menu will expand.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's next to an icon that resembles a gear. It's the first option at the top of the Settings & privacy menu.

steps.title: Click Meta Accounts Center.
steps.content: Click Meta Accounts Center . It's the large box at the top of the left panel. This opens Accounts Center, where you can manage all your Meta accounts.

steps.title: Click Password and security.
steps.content: Click Password and security . This is the first option under "Account settings" in the left panel.

steps.title: Click Where you're logged in.
steps.content: Click Where you're logged in . It's the first option below "Security checks." This displays a list of your various Meta accounts (I.e., Facebook , Instagram, Threads ).

steps.title: Click your Facebook account.
steps.content: Click your Facebook account. If you have more than one Meta account, click your Facebook account. This will display a list of devices you are logged in to. You can also remotely log out of your Instagram or Threads accounts remotely here.

steps.title: Scroll down and click Select devices to log out.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Select devices to log out . It's the red text at the bottom of the list of devices you are logged into.

steps.title: Select the devices you want to log out of.
steps.content: Select the devices you want to log out of. Click the checkbox next to each of the devices you want to log out from. Or, if you want to log out of Messenger everywhere, click Select all at the top.

steps.title: Click Log Out to sign out of Messenger.
steps.content: Click Log Out to sign out of Messenger. It's the blue button at the bottom of the page. This logs you out of Messenger and Facebook on all the devices you selected.
